text:
Hi I would like to use hub db dynamic pages in a react island.
Let's say the island is server side fetching a list of items from a hub db table. An item comes with the page_path for its single page.
What is the best practice for this setup? I guess I still want to create a template but would love not to use HubL, if possible.
Here is the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/dynamic-pages/hubdb|docs> I found of this topic, which I know how to set up in case of a non-react-project, so I wonder if there is some other good practice I might want to adopt.

I would like ideally the single page to receive the item object, and not to fetch it again. The item object can be passed via the parent page, as the listing has already all the information previously fetched via graphql.
Can someone point me to a good direction? :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you!

My need to 'use hub db dynamic pages' is only for SEO purposes. If I can get good SEO done via any other way, then I am also up to go that way. For these reasons I believe React Router is not a good way to go.

> For proxying use cases, a build must be ran first, local edits wonâ€™t be reflected without a new build
Would be handy to include this in the docs :+1:
+1 to add a feature that shows us where modules are being used (I keep running into this use case)
